title: Margo Price talks AI, bro-country and meeting Joan Baez at the circus
author: Lauren Daley
bullets: Margo Price reflects on her influences including Joan Baez and the challenges of being a female artist in country music.
Price discusses her latest album 'Hard Headed Woman', which earned two Grammy nominations for its defiant themes.
Her husband, Jeremy Ivey, has ties to Massachusetts, having been homeless in Boston before their Nashville meeting.

title: She’s running Boston so children like her daughter get access to healthcare
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Jordan Whitaker is running the 2026 Boston Marathon to support Mass. Eye and Ear.
Her 8-year-old daughter received crucial medical care for infected cysts at Mass. Eye and Ear.
Mass. Eye and Ear provided her daughter with necessary surgery, resolving sleep apnea and cyst issues.

title: A.J. Brown’s Eagles teammate doesn’t buy Patriots trade possibility
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: A.J. Brown reportedly shut down Patriots trade rumors, calling his comments on the matter 'trolling.'
Brown's teammate Saquon Barkley stated Brown's wink about joining the Patriots was made in jest and he's a Patriots fan.
ESPN's Adam Schefter suggested that a trade involving A.J. Brown to the Patriots could still be possible this offseason.

title: Here’s what Boston meteorologists are saying about the timing and impacts of the Sunday-Monday nor’easter
author: John Waller
bullets: NWS forecasts 10-20 inches of snow across eastern MA and RI, with potential blizzard conditions.
Worst storm impact expected Sunday night through midday Monday, with possible blizzard and power outages.
Coastal flooding risk due to 3-foot storm surge and high tide, peaking early Monday morning.

title: Alex Bregman declines to respond to Sam Kennedy’s comments about player’s Red Sox departure
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Alex Bregman chose not to engage with Sam Kennedy's remarks about his offseason departure from the Red Sox.
Red Sox president Sam Kennedy suggested Bregman could have stayed with the team if he wanted to.
Bregman cited a no-trade clause from the Cubs as one factor in his decision, but remained vague on other reasons.

title: 5 must-watch movies & TV shows streaming right now
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: 'Apocalypse Now (Redux)' streaming on Pluto TV and Plex honors Robert Duvall after his passing.
'The Last Thing He Told Me' Season 2 follows Jennifer Garner in Apple TV's adaptation of Dave's sequel.
'The Night Agent' Season 3 on Netflix sends Gabriel Basso's character to Istanbul for a high-stakes mission.

title: Red Sox INF Marcelo Mayer has to earn spot on Opening Day roster, Alex Cora says
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Red Sox manager Alex Cora stated Marcelo Mayer must earn his spot on the Opening Day roster this spring.
Mayer, 23, needs to improve offensively despite strong defense; he hit .228 with 4 home runs in 44 games last season.
Mayer is fully healthy for 2026 spring training, an opportunity after previous seasons were cut short by injuries.

title: 7 maps predicting snowfall totals Sunday-Monday
author: John Waller
bullets: A major winter storm is forecast to bring 10 to 20 inches of snow to eastern Massachusetts and Rhode Island.
Blizzard conditions with strong winds and potential power outages are expected late Sunday night into Monday.
Meteorologists caution that weather models and snowfall predictions are subject to change over the next 48 hours.

title: Lindsay Clancy appears in court for first in-person hearing since allegedly killing her children
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Lindsay Clancy attended her first in-person court hearing, facing charges of killing her three children in 2023.
Clancy, represented by attorney Kevin Reddington, plans to pursue an insanity defense at her July murder trial.
Her defense argues she experienced a psychotic break from undiagnosed bipolar disorder and excessive medication.

title: Cape Cod adopts transfer fee on home sales over $1 million
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Barnstable County Assembly of Delegates approved a real estate transfer fee on home sales over $1 million.
The fee aims to raise $60 million annually for housing, with a percentage applied to sales above $1 million.
If the measure passes, towns may adopt the fee through a Town Meeting vote and subsequent town election.
